Package ch.unibas.informatik.cs101

Class ImageWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • ch.unibas.informatik.cs101.ImageWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
    public class ImageWindow
extends java.awt.Component
    A class that manages a java swing window, allowing for easy manipulation of a framebuffer as well as mouse and keyboard polling.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from class java.awt.Component

      Returns the current height of the image in pixels.

      Returns the current width of the image in pixels.

      Returns the mouse coordinates relative to the image.
      If the ImageWindow is not open -1,-1 is returned

      Returns the x pixel position of the mouse in relation to the top left image pixel.

      Returns the y pixel position of the mouse in relation to the top left image pixel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ImageWindow

        public ImageWindow​(int width,
                   int height)
        Creates a new instance of the ImageWindow class
        Parameters:
        width - the width of the paint (image) area
        height - the height of the paint (image) area

    • Method Detail

      • resizeImage

        public void resizeImage​(int newWidth,
                        int newHeight)
        Resizes the paint (image) area to the given size. Also resizes the window border around it.
        The old paint area will be copied to the new paint area and clipped if necessary.
        Parameters:
        newWidth - the resized width of the paint area
        newHeight - the resized height of the paint area

      • clearImage

        public void clearImage()
        Resets the image to the color white.

      • fillImage

        public void fillImage​(int red,
                      int green,
                      int blue)
        Fills the image with the color values given.
        Parameters:
        red - the red part of the color 0-255
        green - the green part of the color 0-255
        blue - the blue part of the color 0-255

      • loadImage

        public void loadImage​(java.lang.String filePath)
        Loads images from file and copies it to the framebuffer. Supports BMP, GIF, JPEG, PNG, TIFF and maybe even some others.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the path, including the filename to the image to be loaded

      • setPixel

        public void setPixel​(int x,
                     int y,
                     int red,
                     int green,
                     int blue)
        Sets a pixel to the given color value. The x and y coordinates are horizontal and vertical positions in the image.
        The (0,0) pixel is located at the top left corner of the image, whereas the (image_width-1,image_height-1) pixel is located at the bottom right corner.
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the pixel
        y - the y position of the pixel
        red - the red part of the color 0-255
        green - the green part of the color 0-255
        blue - the blue part of the color 0-255

      • getPixel

        public java.awt.Color getPixel​(int x,
                               int y)
        Returns the color of the image at the specified position
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the pixel
        y - the y position of the pixel
        Returns:
        a java.awt.Color object; i.e. the red channel can be read like this from the object : object.getRed()

      • getPixelRed

        public int getPixelRed​(int x,
                       int y)
        Return the red part of the RGB color at the specified location
        Parameters:
        x - the x position of the pixel
        y - the y position of the pixel
        Returns:
        the red part of the color (int from 0 - 255)

        y - the y position of the pixel
        Returns:
        the red green of the color (int from 0 - 255)

      • getMouseXPos

        public int getMouseXPos()
        Returns the x pixel position of the mouse in relation to the top left image pixel.
        If the ImageWindow is not open -1,-1 is returned
        Returns:
        the x position of the mouse

        Returns the y pixel position of the mouse in relation to the top left image pixel.
        If the ImageWindow is not open -1,-1 is returned
        Returns:
        the y position of the mouse

      • getMousePos

        public java.awt.Point getMousePos()
        Returns the mouse coordinates relative to the image.
        If the ImageWindow is not open -1,-1 is returned
        Returns:
        java.awt.Point

      • setMousePos

        public void setMousePos​(int x,
                        int y)
        Moves the mouse pointer to the x,y location (relative to the image) This might not work on all platforms as stated in the corresponding javadoc: "Note that some platforms require special privileges or extensions to access low-level input control. If the current platform configuration does not allow input control, an AWTException will be thrown when trying to construct Robot objects. For example, X-Window systems will throw the exception if the XTEST 2.2 standard extension is not supported (or not enabled) by the X server."
        Parameters:
        x - the x Position of the mouse
        y - the y Position of the mouse

      • mousePressed

        public boolean mousePressed()
        Checks whether the left mouse button is currently pressed.
        Note this only works accurately if the mouse is over the image.
        Returns:
        the left mouse button state

      • isKeyDown

        public boolean isKeyDown​(int keyCode)
        Checks whether the key with the corresponding keycode is currently held down (pressed).
        Parameters:
        keyCode - the keycode of the key.
        Use constants from java.awt.event.KeyEvent.
        Letters and number are
        KeyEvent.VK_A - KeyEvent.VK_Z and KeyEvent.VK_0 - KeyEvent.VK_9
        More constants are defined in the Key Event javadoc.
        Returns:
        whether the key is currently epressed (true) or not (false)

      • pause

        public void pause​(long milliseconds)
        Pauses this Thread for the number of milliseconds
        Parameters:
        milliseconds - the pause length

        public int getImageWidth()
        Returns the current width of the image in pixels.
        Returns:
        the width of the image in pixels

        public int getImageHeight()
        Returns the current height of the image in pixels.

        the height of the image in pixels
